main event: On March 31, 1957, a U.S. Coast Guard Radar in Brunswick, Georgia, observed a white UFO with a blue overtone moving from South to North at high speed. The object appeared to split in half and went out, leading observers to believe it fell into swamps.
interesting points: The UFO was described as disc-shaped and white in color with a blue overtone.
The observation was made by U.S. Coast Guard-Radar, adding credibility to the sighting.
The object's unusual behavior of splitting in half and going out was noted by the observers.
The report was made by Mr. and Mrs. in Brunswick, Georgia, who are described as reliable persons and graduates of GA Tech.
The conclusion of the report stated insufficient data for evaluation, leaving the sighting unexplained.
sighted object: disc-shaped white UFO with a blue overtone
witnesses: U.S. Coast Guard-Radar, Mr. and Mrs. (described as reliable)
